SEARCH
Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class ClassDiagramManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassDiagramManager
public class ClassDiagramManager extends Object

Class Diagram Manager

The ClassDiagramManager class is responsible for managing the UML Class Diagram within the UML Editor application. It handles the creation, manipulation, and serialization/deserialization of classes, interfaces, and their relationships. The class interacts closely with the ClassDiagramUI to reflect changes in the user interface and ensure synchronization between the model and the view.

Key functionalities include:

  • Adding and recreating class and interface boxes on the drawing pane.
  • Managing relationships such as associations, aggregations, compositions, and inheritances.
  • Handling serialization and deserialization of the class diagram to and from JSON files.
  • Enabling and disabling drag functionality for moving diagram elements.
  • Highlighting elements during user interactions for better visual feedback.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

    • clearDiagram

      public void clearDiagram()
      Clears all elements from the diagram, including classes, interfaces, and relationships.

      This method removes all visual elements from the drawing pane and clears the underlying model.

    • createClassBox

      public void createClassBox(String name, double layoutX, double layoutY)
      Creates a class box at the specified position and adds it to the diagram.

      This method initializes a new class box with the given name and position, adds it to the drawing pane, and updates the underlying model accordingly.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the class.
      layoutX - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      layoutY - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.

    • createInterfaceBox

      public void createInterfaceBox(String name, double layoutX, double layoutY)
      Creates an interface box at the specified position and adds it to the diagram.

      This method initializes a new interface box with the given name and position, adds it to the drawing pane, and updates the underlying model accordingly.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the interface.
      layoutX - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      layoutY - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.

    • findClassBoxByName

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox findClassBoxByName(String name)
      Finds a class box by its name.

      This method searches through the list of classes in the model and returns the corresponding VBox if a match is found.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the class to find.
      Returns:
      The VBox representing the class, or null if not found.

    • findInterfaceBoxByName

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox findInterfaceBoxByName(String name)
      Finds an interface box by its name.

      This method searches through the list of interfaces in the model and returns the corresponding VBox if a match is found.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the interface to find.
      Returns:
      The VBox representing the interface, or null if not found.

    • saveDiagram

      public void saveDiagram(File file)
      Saves the current UML diagram to a JSON file.

      This method delegates the serialization process to the ClassDiagramSerializer and provides user feedback upon successful or failed operations.

      Parameters:
      file - The File object representing the destination JSON file.

    • loadDiagram

      public void loadDiagram(File file)
      Loads a UML diagram from a JSON file.

      This method delegates the deserialization process to the ClassDiagramSerializer, updates the internal model, and refreshes the UI to reflect the loaded diagram.

      Parameters:
      file - The File object representing the source JSON file.

    • handleToolSelection

      public void handleToolSelection(String tool, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane, javafx.scene.layout.VBox editorsPane)
      Handles tool selection and adds corresponding UML elements to the diagram.

      This method determines the type of tool selected by the user (e.g., Class, Interface, Association) and invokes the appropriate method to handle the creation or manipulation of diagram elements.

      Parameters:
      tool - The tool selected (e.g., "Class", "Interface", "Association", "Aggregation", "Composition", "Inheritance", "Drag").
      drawingPane - The Pane where elements are drawn.
      editorsPane - The VBox for displaying editors.

    • enableInheritanceMode

      public void enableInheritanceMode(javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane)
      Enables inheritance mode and handles user interactions for creating inheritances.

      This method sets up mouse click events on the drawing pane to allow users to select two elements between which an inheritance will be created. Upon selecting both elements, the inheritance relationship is established without additional details.

      Parameters:
      drawingPane - The Pane where elements are drawn.

    • setDraggable

      public void setDraggable(javafx.scene.layout.VBox pane, boolean enable)
      Sets a VBox as draggable or non-draggable.

      This method attaches or removes mouse event handlers to enable or disable dragging of the specified VBox element.

      Parameters:
      pane - The VBox to set as draggable or non-draggable.
      enable - true to enable dragging; false to disable.

    • highlightClass

      public void highlightClass(javafx.scene.layout.VBox classBox, boolean highlight)
      Highlights or unhighlights a class/interface box.

      This method changes the visual styling of the specified VBox to indicate whether it is highlighted. Highlighting is typically used during user interactions such as selecting elements for creating relationships.

      Parameters:
      classBox - The VBox representing the class or interface to highlight.
      highlight - true to apply highlighting; false to remove it.

    • getClassByVBox

      public UMLClassBox getClassByVBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox classBox)
      Retrieves a UML class box by its associated VBox.

      This method searches through the list of UML classes in the model and returns the corresponding UMLClassBox if a match is found based on the visual representation.

      Parameters:
      classBox - The VBox representing the class in the UI.
      Returns:
      The corresponding UMLClassBox, or null if not found.

    • getInterfaceByVBox

      public UMLInterfaceBox getInterfaceByVBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox interfaceBox)
      Retrieves a UML interface box by its associated VBox.

      This method searches through the list of UML interfaces in the model and returns the corresponding UMLInterfaceBox if a match is found based on the visual representation.

      Parameters:
      interfaceBox - The VBox representing the interface in the UI.
      Returns:
      The corresponding UMLInterfaceBox, or null if not found.

    • createRelationshipFromSerialization

      public void createRelationshipFromSerialization(UMLRelationship umlRelationship)
      Creates a relationship based on serialized data.

      This method reconstructs a UML relationship (e.g., association, aggregation) from serialized UMLRelationship data and adds it to the drawing pane.

      Parameters:
      umlRelationship - The UMLRelationship data used to create the relationship.

    • reCreateClassBox

      public void reCreateClassBox(String name, double layoutX, double layoutY, List<String> attributes, List<String> methods)
      Recreates a UML class box in the UI and updates the internal model.

      This method is used during deserialization to reconstruct class boxes with their attributes and methods.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the class.
      layoutX - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      layoutY - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      attributes - The list of attributes for the class.
      methods - The list of methods for the class.

    • reCreateInterfaceBox

      public void reCreateInterfaceBox(String name, double layoutX, double layoutY, List<String> methods)
      Recreates a UML interface box in the UI and updates the internal model.

      This method is used during deserialization to reconstruct interface boxes.

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the interface.
      layoutX - The X-coordinate position on the drawing pane.
      layoutY - The Y-coordinate position on the drawing pane.

    • getClassBoxMap

      public Map<String,UMLElementBoxInterface> getClassBoxMap()
      Getter for the class-box mapping.
      Returns:
      The mapping from element names to their corresponding UML element boxes.

    • addRelationshipBox

      public void addRelationshipBox(UMLRelationshipBox relationshipBox)
      Adds a UMLRelationshipBox to the internal model.

      This method registers a new relationship in the class diagram's relationship list.

      Parameters:
      relationshipBox - The UMLRelationshipBox instance representing the relationship.

    • updateRelationshipsForRenamedClass

      public void updateRelationshipsForRenamedClass(String oldName, String newName)
      Updates all relationships that reference a renamed class.

      This method ensures that any relationships involving a class or interface that has been renamed are updated to reflect the new name, maintaining consistency within the diagram.

      Parameters:
      oldName - The old name of the class or interface.
      newName - The new name of the class or interface.

    • getUiController

      public ClassDiagramUI getUiController()
      Retrieves the UI controller associated with this manager.
      Returns:
      The ClassDiagramUI instance.

    • isClassNameExists

      public boolean isClassNameExists(String name)
      Checks if a class or interface name already exists in the diagram.

      This method prevents duplicate names within the class diagram, ensuring that each class or interface has a unique identifier.

      Parameters:
      name - The name to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the name exists; false otherwise.

    • exportAsImage

      public void exportAsImage(File file) throws IOException
      Exports the current class diagram as an image file.

      This method captures a snapshot of the drawing pane, converts it to a BufferedImage, and writes it to the specified file in the appropriate image format (PNG or JPEG).

      Parameters:
      file - The File object representing the destination image file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during writing the image.

    • deleteSelectedElement

      public void deleteSelectedElement(javafx.scene.layout.VBox selectedElement)
      Deletes the selected element (class or interface) from the UI and data model, and removes any associated relationships.

      If the element type cannot be determined or no element is selected, no action is taken.

      Triggers an object explorer update callback, if provided.

      Parameters:
      selectedElement - The VBox containing the element to delete, with its name in a label.
